examQuestions32.text: When driving by the right edge of the roadway in this situation should you signal the intention to change the lane?
In the presented situation, can you stop the vehicle on the shoulder before the sign?
Are you allowed to stop the vehicle for 1 minute beyond this sign?
In this situation, are you being warned of two dangerous bends, the first to the right?
You are turning right and the driver of the oncoming car intends to turn left. Do you have the right of way over him?
After entering the road marked with these vertical signs, do you have the right to continue driving at a speed of 30 km/h?
You intend to go straight on, while the motorcyclist intends to turn left. Do you have to yield the right of way to the motorcyclist?
Are you allowed in this situation to drive onto the adjacent right lane?
Can the emergency route created as shown in the picture for an emergency vehicle be used by the driver of an emergency roadside assistance vehicle taking part in a rescue operation?
In this situation, are you obliged to continue driving in the right lane?
In the situation presented, are you obliged to give way to the pedestrian?
Are you allowed in this situation to overtake the vehicle?
Is it forbidden to park the car immediately after the countdown post you see here?
In conditions of a significant reduction in speed on the roadway, will the driver of vehicle 2 drive ahead of vehicle 3?
Are you allowed in this situation, in the built-up area, to overtake the vehicle from the right?
If you turn right at this intersection, do you have the right of way over the approaching vehicle?
In this situation, are you entitled to continue driving without stopping?
Can you continue going straight through the line designating a stop area (a zigzag line)?
In this situation, when driving straight through an intersection, can you refrain from taking extra care?

When approaching the stopping place for a school bus outside the built-up area, are you obliged to allow the driver of the bus to enter the roadway, if it signals the intention to perform such a manoeuvre?
Is the weather condition a factor to consider when choosing a driving speed?
examQuestions32.b: Yes, but only when there is heavy traffic on the road.

examQuestions32.text: How should you properly position the rear-view mirror?
examQuestions32.a: In any position, depending what you want to see.
examQuestions32.b: In such a way as to see the rear car window and the road behind the car.
examQuestions32.c: In such a way as to see the passenger sitting at the back.

examQuestions32.text: Does the driving licence - cat. B entitle you to ride a moped or a light 4-wheel vehicle?
examQuestions32.a: Yes, but only outside a built-up area.
examQuestions32.b: Yes.

examQuestions32.text: What may be the effect of worn shock absorbers on the front wheels?
examQuestions32.b: Decreased tyre grip and steerability of the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: What should you see in a properly-positioned rear-view mirror?
examQuestions32.a: The child sitting in the child safety seat behind the passenger's seat.
examQuestions32.b: The reflection of the driver's own face.
examQuestions32.c: The rear car window and the road behind the car.

examQuestions32.text: What behaviour increases the risk of skidding on icy road surfaces?
examQuestions32.b: Engine braking.
examQuestions32.c: Violent turning of the steering wheel.

examQuestions32.text: What can you not do when involved in an accident in which there are casualties?
examQuestions32.b: Administer first aid.
examQuestions32.c: Move the vehicle to the hard shoulder.

examQuestions32.text: While driving a passenger car, what should you see in properly-adjusted external mirrors ("rear-view mirrors")?
examQuestions32.a: Only the sides of the car.
examQuestions32.b: The area behind the car and the sides of the car.

examQuestions32.text: What distance from the preceding vehicle should you maintain standing before an interection, waiting for the green signal?
examQuestions32.b: Maximum of 10 m, minimum of 1 m.

examQuestions32.text: What is the role of a properly placed headrest in case of a road accident?
examQuestions32.a: It protects the top of the head.
examQuestions32.b: It protects the cervical vertebrae.

examQuestions32.text: At what maximum speed limit can you drive, on the road past this sign?
examQuestions32.b: Up to 30 km/h.

examQuestions32.text: Is an adult passenger of a passenger car transported in the back seat obliged to use the seat belts?
examQuestions32.b: Yes, but only when the car goes outside a built-up area.

examQuestions32.text: Are you allowed to stop your vehicle on this hard shoulder?
Do you have to be extra careful when approaching a junction from a priority road?
You are changing from the left lane to the middle lane. Did you have the right of way over the vehicle entering the lane from the right in this situation?
You intend to turn left. Do you have the right of way over the vehicle approaching from the left?
In this situation, can you use high-beam lights?
Are you allowed to drive in any lane on the motorway regardless of the traffic situation?
Does the visible horizontal sign separate traffic lanes designated for pedestrian traffic in the same direction?
In the presented situation, are you approaching a crossroad with a side road?
You need rest. Are you allowed to pull over for a short while on the presented hard shoulder?
In the presented situation, are you approaching a level crossing without a barrier?
In this situation, can you turn right at the nearest crossroads?
Are you allowed to continue going straight in the lane you are now taking?
You intend to turn left. Are you obliged to yield the right of way to the vehicle approaching from the right?
In this situation, is it permissible to continue driving in the left lane if the right lane is free?
After the visible sign, are you allowed to stop the vehicle for more than 1 minute?
Is driving a vehicle under the influence of alcohol subject to violation?
Are you taking the proper lane in this situation?
In this situation, are you allowed to drive straight ahead at the intersection without stopping?
You intend to turn left. Do you have to yield the right of way to the vehicle approaching from the right?
Do you have to exercise particular caution in the presented situation?
Why is the side position is a safe position for unconscious as well as breathing persons?
examQuestions32.a: Because it provides the victim with the greatest comfort while waiting for the ambulance.
examQuestions32.b: Because it protects against injuries of the neck section of the spine.
examQuestions32.c: Because it prevents any blocking of the respiratory tract and choking.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following are mandatory equipment in each passenger car?
examQuestions32.b: A set of spare bulbs.
examQuestions32.c: A loud-speaking device for the telephone.

examQuestions32.text: What auditory signals can you emit from a motor vehicle?
examQuestions32.b: Any tone

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following activities is prohibited while driving a vehicle?
examQuestions32.b: Using a GPS navigation.
examQuestions32.c: Talking on a telephone that requires the user to hold a receiver or microphone in his hand.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following numbers should you call in order to call an ambulance to the scene of a road accident?
Which of the following activities is prohibited while driving a vehicle?
examQuestions32.b: Using a GPS navigation.
examQuestions32.c: Talking on a telephone that requires the user to hold a receiver or microphone in his hand.

examQuestions32.text: The document certifying that a vehicle is approved for traffic is:
examQuestions32.b: vehicle history card.

examQuestions32.text: Whic of these factors has a direct impact on the total stopping distance of a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: The amount of fuel in the tank.
examQuestions32.b: The condition of the steering system.
examQuestions32.c: The reaction time of the vehicle driver.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the values below should you take into account when establishing the distance between the vehicle in front?
examQuestions32.b: The length of the vehicles.

examQuestions32.text: What conditions must be met when transporting a child in the back seat of a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: The child being carried is at least 135 cm tall and fastened only with seat belts, as the weight and height precludes carriage in a safety seat or other child restraint systems.
examQuestions32.b: The child being carried is at least 125 cm tall and is only fastened with seat belts, as its weight and height precludes carriage in a safety seat.
examQuestions32.c: The speed must not exceed 50 km/h.

examQuestions32.text: What should you do upon determining improper engine oil pressure?
examQuestions32.b: Check the oil level and eventaully replenish.
examQuestions32.c: Always turn on the hazard warning lights.

examQuestions32.text: What are responsibilities of the person involved in the traffic accident in which there are victims?
examQuestions32.a: Promptly remove the vehicle from the road so as not to block traffic.
examQuestions32.b: Promptly remove any damaged vehicle parts from the road so as not to impede traffic.
examQuestions32.c: Offer assistance to victims of the accident as well as call an ambulance and the Police.

examQuestions32.text: Does the board placed under this warning sign indicate the sign's distance from a dangerous spot?
Are you allowed to overtake a vehicle on the right in this section of the one-way road?
Will you be able in this situation to turn left properly from the right lane you are taking?
In this situation, are you allowed to turn right without stopping?
After turning left, do the signs on the crosswise roadway prohibit you from going to the right uttermost lane?
You intend to go straight ahead. Do you have priority over the vehicle approaching from the right?
In this situation, can you bypass the car visible on the right?
In this situation, are you obliged to exercise particular caution?
In the presented situation, is it mandatory to stop before entering this intersection?
You intend to turn left at the intersection. Are you obliged in this situation to give way to the oncoming vehicle going straight ahead?
Are you allowed in this situation to change the lane you are taking when you intend to go straight?
In this situation, can you change to the right lane?
In this situation, are you obliged to exercise extreme caution when driving past a vehicle from the opposite direction?
In the presented situation, seeing the injured person with his head submerged in the water, should you  leave him unmoved for fear of injuring his spine?
In the present situation, are you obliged to let the vehicle on the right to pass?
Can you stop your vehicle in any place if there is a need to yield the right of way to the vehicle?
Are you properly preparing to drive past in this situation?
In this situation, can you make a U-turn at the intersection?
In this situation, do you have the right to drive behind the signalling device?
Do you have to comply with the "STOP" sign in the presented situation?
How is it recommended to transport an infant in a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: In any baby carrier, as long as the infant is fastened with seat belts.
examQuestions32.b: In a child safety seat suitable for infants.
examQuestions32.c: On the lap of an adult person who has the seat belts fastened.

examQuestions32.text: How is braking on a wet road affected by using tyres having tread wear exceeding maximum safety limits?
examQuestions32.b: The shortening of the braking distance.
examQuestions32.c: Decrease of friction and the lengthening of the braking distance.

examQuestions32.text: In what gear should you start driving on a dry surface?
examQuestions32.b: The lowest.

examQuestions32.text: What would be most affected by wrong adjustment of external mirrors in a motor vehicle?
examQuestions32.b: Safety during lane changes.

examQuestions32.text: In what order should you perform the following activities when preparing to drive a vehicle?
examQuestions32.a: Fasten the seat belts, position the mirrors and the driver's seat.
examQuestions32.b: Position the mirrors, the driver's seat and fasten the seat belts.
examQuestions32.c: Position the driver's seat, mirrors and fasten the seat belts.

examQuestions32.text: What documents are you obliged to carry with you and present at the request of the relevant authority during roadside inspections?
examQuestions32.a: A medical certificate if you are involved in commercial passenger transport.
examQuestions32.b: A driving license retention receipt for the period it permits the driver to drive.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the mentioned body parts is the headrest on the vehicle seat designed to protect?
examQuestions32.b: The frontal bone

examQuestions32.text: What can you expect while braking forcefully in these road conditions?
examQuestions32.a: Increased traction of the wheels to the road.
examQuestions32.b: Increased friction.
examQuestions32.c: Decreased traction of the wheels to the road.

examQuestions32.text: Which gear is appropriate to start driving a passenger car on a dry surface?
examQuestions32.b: First.
examQuestions32.c: The one in which the driving stopped.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following actions towards a person injured in an accident may entail penal liability?
examQuestions32.b: An unprofessional rescue action.
examQuestions32.c: Any unprofessional and incorrectly performed rescue action.

examQuestions32.text: What should you use as a dressing of severely-bleeding wounds?
examQuestions32.b: A pressure dressing of gauze, cloth and bandage.

examQuestions32.text: Are you allowed to park on the marked parking areas for disabled people, if your parking ticket expired?
examQuestions32.a: Yes, unless the time period since that didn't exceed 7 days.
examQuestions32.b: Yes, unless the time period since that didn't exceed 14 days.

examQuestions32.text: Are you entitled to drive a vehicle after any drug available without a prescription?
Are you approaching a major road in the presented situation?
Does this sign indicate entry into a residential area?
In this situation, while exercising special caution, can you bypass the tram?
In this situation, is the outermost right lane only intended for rail vehicles?
In this situation, do you have the right of way over a tram?
On a road, past this sign, can you make a U-turn?
Should you signal your intention to turn right in this situation?
You have just stopped your vehicle. Did you do it in the correct place in consideration of the light signal given?
Are you allowed to use high-beam lights in this situation?
In this situation, are you obliged to yield the right of way to the vehicle approaching from the right?
In this situation, can you change lanes immediately before the intersection?
The driver of the oncoming car intends to turn left. Do you have to yield the right of way to him?
Does this dashed line in this situation indicate a place to stop because of the "stop" sign?
You are going straight ahead. Are you obliged to yield the right of way to the motorcyclist?
Can you make a U-turn at the nearest intersection?
Are you obliged to have the left indicator permanently switched on when driving straight ahead due to passing of parked vehicles.
In the presented situation, are you allowed to pull over by the kerb before the sign?
Does this sign warn you of an area that experiences intense precipitation?
Does the light signal for you lane allow for making a U-turn in this situation?
When should you conduct a periodic technical check-up of a passenger car?
examQuestions32.b: Every 2 years.
examQuestions32.c: Before the lapse of a deadline specified on the registration card of the car.

examQuestions32.text: You are driving at the speed of 90 km/h. What starting position will ensure optimal trajectory on the bend?
examQuestions32.a: In the middle of the road, partially crossing the line shown.
examQuestions32.b: By the line dividing the lanes - on the right side of the roadway.
examQuestions32.c: By the right edge of the road.

examQuestions32.text: What obligation do you have as the owner of a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: Submitting the vehicle to regular technical inspections.
examQuestions32.b: Concluding the accident insurance.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following combination vehicles can you drive if you have a B-category driving licence?
examQuestions32.a: A truck with gross vehicle weight of 2.5 t, with a light trailer.
examQuestions32.b: A farm tractor with two trailers.
examQuestions32.c: A passenger car with a trailer, as long as their gross vehicle weight amounts to up to 4.5 t.

examQuestions32.text: How does the braking distance of the vehicle change dependent on the speed increase?
examQuestions32.a: The braking distance increases with an increase in speed.
examQuestions32.b: The braking distance is decreses with an increase in speed.
examQuestions32.c: The driving speed has no influence on the braking distance.

examQuestions32.text: What does a safe distance you should keep while driving behind another car depend on?
examQuestions32.a: On the speed with which you're driving.
examQuestions32.b: On the power of your engine.
examQuestions32.c: On the width of the road.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following road elements should you observe when driving on the highway?
examQuestions32.a: Only the traffic lane in front of your vehicle.
examQuestions32.b: The entire roadway and hard shoulder in front and behind the vehicle.
examQuestions32.c: Only your traffic lane and the right hard shoulder in front of the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: Where a driver has exceeded the speed limit by more than 50 km/h in a built-up area, the starost shall issue an administrative decision to withhold the driving licence for:
examQuestions32.b: 2 months.

examQuestions32.text: At what speed are you allowed to drive a passenger car on the road beyond this sign?
examQuestions32.b: 30 km/h.

examQuestions32.text: What speed must you drive on a motorway?
examQuestions32.b: At least 60 km/h.
examQuestions32.c: A speed which does not cause an obstacle for other drivers, but not exceeding the maximum speed limit.

examQuestions32.text: What distance should you maintain from the vehicle in front in the presented situation?
examQuestions32.a: A distance necessary to avoid a collision in the event the preceding vehicle brakes or stops.
examQuestions32.b: No less than 10 metres.

examQuestions32.text: What is the purpose of using the ASR system in a passenger car?
examQuestions32.b: Preventing blocking of the braked wheels.

examQuestions32.text: Is stopover of the vehicle allowed on this hard shoulder?
Does the signal mean that in a while the red signal comes on?
Does the signal displayed by the authorised person indicate that in a moment you will be allowed to enter the junction?
Are you allowed in this place to turn left and drive into the petrol station?
You intend to turn left, and the driver of the vehicle approaching from the opposite direction plans to drive straight ahead. Are you obliged to yield the right of way?
Does a yellow flashing signal indicate that the red signal is about to come on?
You plan to turn right and the bus driver intends to turn left. Have you got priority over him?
Does this horizontal triangular sign confirm the warning of an intersection with the main road?
You intend to turn right, and the driver approaching from the opposite direction plans to turn left. Do you have have the right of way?
Did the driver properly secure the car before leaving it?
In this situation, are you allowed to use the horn?
In the presented situation, are you allowed to make a U-turn at the intersection?
In this situation, are you approaching an uncontrolled intersection?
Are you obliged to stop the vehicle in this situation?
If you turn left at this intersection, do you have the right of way over the approaching vehicle?
Can you park the car at a distance of 5 m from a pedestrian crossing?
When driving a vehicle, does your ability to perceive road signs and signals improve with time?
In conditions of a significant reduction in speed on the roadway, will the driver of Vehicle 4 drive ahead of the driver of Vehicle 2?
When changing lanes on an unmarked roadway, are you exempt from signalling this manoeuvre with the appropriate turn signal?
Are you allowed in this situation to stay on the left lane, when there are no vehicles driving on the right lane?
Which of the following lights are you allowed to use when you are driving a passenger car during a fog?
examQuestions32.b: Front fog lights.

examQuestions32.text: What can you expect on a road marked this way?
examQuestions32.a: That there is a collision-free passage for wild animals underneath the road.
examQuestions32.b: That wild animals may be running across the road.
examQuestions32.c: That animals may be herded across the road.

examQuestions32.text: As a driver, can you walk away from a vehicle while the engine is running?
examQuestions32.b: Yes, for only 1 minute.

examQuestions32.text: How can you carry a load on a trailer pulled by a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: The load may cover some lights of the trailer.
examQuestions32.b: The load must not disturb the steerability of the vehicle.
examQuestions32.c: The load does not have to be secured against the change of position.

examQuestions32.text: What should you do in this situation?
examQuestions32.a: You have the right to change traffic lanes to the left.
examQuestions32.b: You should remain on the traffic lane you are taking.
examQuestions32.c: When changing lanes you need not exercise special caution.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the control lights visible in the illustration informs you that the main beam lights are enabled?
examQuestions32.b: B.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following factors may restrict the field of view of a passenger car's driver?
examQuestions32.a: Blinking his eyes during a brake in driving.
examQuestions32.b: 15 minutes of rest after two hours of driving.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following actions may contribute to an increase in safety level while driving on the road covered with snow?
examQuestions32.a: Braking only with a hand brake.
examQuestions32.b: Using winter tires.

examQuestions32.text: What should you do if you identify an open fracture?
examQuestions32.b: Immobilize two adjacent joints.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the control lights visible in the illustration informs you that the rear windscreen heater is enabled?
examQuestions32.b: B.

examQuestions32.text: At what speed is a passenger car permitted to travel on a motorway?
examQuestions32.a: At a speed of not more than 140 km/h, while maintaining control of the vehicle and taking into account the prevailing traffic conditions.
examQuestions32.b: At a speed of not less than 40 km/h, taking into account the prevailing weather conditions (blizzard, downpour, etc.).
examQuestions32.c: At any speed that ensures control of the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: How will you place luggage in a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: I will place the heaviest luggage deepest and lowest, in the central part of the boot.
examQuestions32.b: Whatever way.
examQuestions32.c: I will place the heaviest luggage in the upper part of the boot, over the lighter one.

examQuestions32.text: Is it allowed to overtake a motor vehicle in such a place on the road?
In the presented situation, are you allowed to drive through the railway crossing without stopping?
You intend to turn left at the nearest junction. Should you immediately start changing lanes?
You intend to turn right. Are you obliged to yield the right of way to the oncoming vehicle that is turning left?
After performing a manoeuvre to the right at this intersection, are you obliged  to switch off the indicator?
In this situation, are you obliged to exercise particular caution?
Should you exercise special caution when turning left at this intersection?
Are you allowed to increase your speed to 130 km/h beyond this sign?
Are you allowed to turn right in this situation if you do not cause impediments to traffic?
Should you signal the fact of parking a broken-down car on an area excluded from driving?
Upon stopping a vehicle for inspection, should the driver keep his or her hands on the steering wheel?
Do you have to yield the right of way at the nearest crossroads to all vehicles approaching from the right?
On a road, once you go past this sign, can you make a U-turn?
Are you allowed to turn left from the lane you are occupying?
Does the horizontal dotted line visible in this intersection indicate continuation of the traffic lane occupied?

In the situation presented, does the visible sign warn you of two dangerous bends, the first of which is to the direction indicated on the sign, and the second of which may be to the left or to the right?
In the presented situation, are you approaching the intersection from a road without right of way?
In this situation, seeing the behaviour of the cyclists, are you obliged to stop?
Are you allowed to stop your vehicle on this bridge, in order to drop off passengers?
In this situation, are you obliged each time to stop your vehicle before entering the intersection?
What behaviour increases the risk of skidding on icy road surfaces?
examQuestions32.b: Engine braking.

examQuestions32.text: Which of these factors should you take into account when executing an overtaking manoeuvre?
examQuestions32.b: Maintaining a safe distance.

examQuestions32.text: What is the influence of the speed of driving on the field of view of a passenger car driver?
examQuestions32.a: When the speed increases the field of view narrows down.
examQuestions32.b: When the speed increases the field of view expands.

examQuestions32.text: While driving a car in wintertime and you see a blue, half-conscious, freezing person on the shoulder, how should you help him?
examQuestions32.b: Give him alcohol.
examQuestions32.c: Take him to the car, cover him and have him warm up slowly.

examQuestions32.text: In case of a wound hemorrhage and lack of sterile dressing you should:
examQuestions32.b: use the clothing of an injured person as dressing.
examQuestions32.c: wait until somebody lends you the first aid kit.

examQuestions32.text: What document are you obliged to carry with you and present at the request of a competent authority?
examQuestions32.a: Proof of participation in a pre-qualification training course.
examQuestions32.b: A document certifying the right to drive a vehicle other than a national driving licence.
examQuestions32.c: Document confirming the completion of pre-medical first aid training.

examQuestions32.text: In what way does the speed of the car affect the field of vision?
examQuestions32.a: The field of vision decreases along with an increase in speed.
examQuestions32.b: The field of vision increases along with an increase in speed.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following emergency braking techniques should be applied in a passenger car fitted with ABS?
examQuestions32.a: Quickly and firmly depress the brake pedal.
examQuestions32.b: Smoothly depress the brake pedal, gradually increasing the pressure until the ABS activates.

examQuestions32.text: What should you pay special attention to while reversing the car?
examQuestions32.a: Any objects which are around and which are approaching the car.
examQuestions32.b: That you firmly keep your hand on the gear stick.
examQuestions32.c: The positioning of the steering wheel in order to determine the driving trajectory.

examQuestions32.text: For which of the following states of the engine should the oil level in the engine be checked?
examQuestions32.b: Immediately after the engine is switched off.
examQuestions32.c: Before the cold engine is started or at least a few minutes after switching it off.

examQuestions32.text: What may be the consequences of a driver's failure to fasten their seat belts?
examQuestions32.a: More damage to the car in the event of a collision.
examQuestions32.b: More bodily injuries suffered by the driver in the event of an accident.

examQuestions32.text: In which picture is the headrest properly mounted?
examQuestions32.b: B
